title: Useful Kubernetes Commands
content:
# Useful Kubernetes Commands

A collection of commands I frequently use when working with Kubernetes.

## Viewing Resources

```bash
# Get all pods in the current namespace
kubectl get pods

# Get all pods in all namespaces
kubectl get pods --all-namespaces

# Get detailed information about a specific pod
kubectl describe pod <pod-name>
```

## Logs and Debugging

```bash
# View logs for a pod
kubectl logs <pod-name>

# Stream logs for a pod
kubectl logs -f <pod-name>

# Execute a command in a container
kubectl exec -it <pod-name> -- /bin/bash
```

## Deployment Management

```bash
# Scale a deployment
kubectl scale deployment <deployment-name> --replicas=3

# Rollout status
kubectl rollout status deployment/<deployment-name>

# Rollback to previous version
kubectl rollout undo deployment/<deployment-name>
```

Remember to always check the context before running commands in production environments!

title: AWS CLI Cheatsheet
content:
# AWS CLI Cheatsheet

Common AWS CLI commands I use for managing resources.

## EC2

```bash
# List all EC2 instances
aws ec2 describe-instances

# List EC2 instances with specific filters
aws ec2 describe-instances --filters "Name=instance-type,Values=t2.micro"

# Start/stop instances
aws ec2 start-instances --instance-ids i-1234567890abcdef0
aws ec2 stop-instances --instance-ids i-1234567890abcdef0
```

## S3

```bash
# List all buckets
aws s3 ls

# List contents of a bucket
aws s3 ls s3://my-bucket/

# Copy file to S3
aws s3 cp myfile.txt s3://my-bucket/

# Sync directory with S3
aws s3 sync my-directory s3://my-bucket/my-directory
```

## ECS

```bash
# List clusters
aws ecs list-clusters

# List services in a cluster
aws ecs list-services --cluster my-cluster

# Update service (e.g., to force deployment)
aws ecs update-service --cluster my-cluster --service my-service --force-new-deployment
```

## CloudFormation

```bash
# List stacks
aws cloudformation list-stacks

# Create stack
aws cloudformation create-stack --stack-name my-stack --template-body file://template.yaml

# Update stack
aws cloudformation update-stack --stack-name my-stack --template-body file://template.yaml
```
